description: As Syrian Kurds fled Islamic State forces, Turkey was caught between conflicting interests in the fighting.
title: A Refugee Crisis at the Turkish Border
title_page: A Refugee Crisis at the Turkish Border - The New York Times
text: Kurds in Turkey watched Saturday as Kurdish forces fought Islamic State militants just across the border in Syria. Although Turkey has accepted nearly 150,000 refugees, mostly Kurdish, from Kobani, Syria, in the last week, it fears emboldening Kurdish separatists.
